intro: Dorstenia subrhombiformis, commonly known as the rhombic false fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its unique, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically greenish-white in color, and it produces edible fruits that are consumed by various wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
